intro: Bilabrella diselloides, commonly known as the slender bilabrella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
